description: The goalkeeper is the last line of defense, responsible for preventing the opposition from scoring. Modern goalkeepers are also increasingly involved in build-up play and initiating attacks.

roles.description: A traditional goalkeeper whose primary responsibility is to stop shots and command his area. He will generally stay on his line and distribute the ball quickly to start counter-attacks.

mentalities.description: Stays close to goal line, focuses purely on shot-stopping and commanding his area. Rarely ventures outside the penalty box and prioritizes safety first in distribution.

roles.description: A more modern interpretation of the position, the sweeper keeper is comfortable leaving his area to act as a sweeper behind the defense, particularly when facing through balls. Requires good anticipation, acceleration and passing skills.

mentalities.description: Will sweep up behind defense but generally stays closer to his goal than other mentalities. Acts as a safety net but doesn't actively participate in build-up play.
Proactive in sweeping up through balls and participates actively in build-up play. Will often function as an extra passing option for defenders under pressure.
Extremely aggressive in sweeping up through balls and often acts as an 11th outfield player in possession. Takes high risks with positioning and distribution to support attacking play.

description: Defenders are responsible for stopping the opposition's attacks and protecting their goal. They play a crucial role in maintaining the team's defense structure and initiating attacks from the back.

roles.description: A traditional central defender focused on marking, tackling, and clearing danger. Typically strong in the air and excellent at positioning.

mentalities.description: Focuses purely on defense duties, marking tightly and clearing danger. Rarely ventures forward and maintains disciplined positioning.
Aggressively steps out of defense to close down opponents and win the ball higher up the pitch. Takes more risks in defense positioning.
Provides cover for more aggressive defense partners, sweeping up behind the defense line and using anticipation to intercept passes.

roles.description: A creative defender who operates behind the defense line, starting attacks with intelligent passing while providing defense cover.

mentalities.description: Focuses on defense positioning and initiating attacks from deep. Provides a safety net behind the defense while distributing the ball intelligently.
More adventurous in possession, stepping into midfield to support attacks while maintaining defense responsibilities.

roles.description: A central defender with excellent technical skills who looks to start attacks with precise passing while maintaining solid defense fundamentals.

mentalities.description: Maintains defense discipline while looking to distribute the ball intelligently from the back. Takes fewer risks in possession than more attacking mentalities.
Steps out of defense aggressively to win the ball and start attacks quickly. Takes more risks both defensely and in possession.
Provides defense cover while using excellent passing range to launch attacks from deep positions. Reads the game well to intercept passes.

roles.description: A traditional, physical defender who focuses purely on defense duties and clears danger immediately without attempting to play out from the back.

mentalities.description: Focuses exclusively on defense duties, clearing the ball immediately when under pressure. Strong in the air and in tackles.
Aggressively closes down opponents and wins the ball early, clearing danger immediately rather than playing out.

roles.description: A central defender who operates in wider areas, often in back three systems. Combines defense solidity with the ability to support attacks in wide areas.

description: Full-backs provide width in both defense and attacking phases, requiring stamina to cover the entire flank. They balance defense responsibilities with supporting attacks through overlapping runs or inverted positioning.

Adjusts mentality based on team strategy - defends when team is defending, supports in balanced approaches, and attacks when team is pushing forward.

Adjusts mentality based on team strategy - more defense when protecting a lead, more attacking when chasing a game. The default balanced option.
